Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
Game Duration

  • Games will last five innings or 50 minutes. One inning consists of each team batting and fielding once.

Homerun Rule 

  • Each team will be allowed two over the fence home runs per game
  • After the first two over the fence home runs, all subsequent fair untouched fly balls over-the-fence will be ruled a ground rule double.

Batting 

  • Teams may bat seven (minimum) to ten (maximum) players and no more than five men. Players batting must also play the field during the same inning in which they bat
  • All at-bats will begin with 1 ball and 1 strike
  • Teams will bat until three (3) outs are recorded
  • Teams must follow the batting order as stated on the lineup card.
  • If a team is forced to bat two of the same gender in a row, following the batting order, the team receives an out.
  • The batting (offensive) team is responsible for retrieving foul balls and home run balls.
  • A full swing must be used every pitch. No bunting or chopping the ball downward will be allowed. Violating this rule will be called a dead ball, the batter will be called out and all runners will return to bases occupied before the play began.
  • If a batter is intentionally walked, he/she will automatically be placed on second base and the following batter will be able to choose if they would like to be placed on first base or be up to bat.

Infield Fly Rule 

  • An infield fly is a fly ball that an infielder can catch with normal effort when there are runners on first and second, or first, second and third. When the umpire calls infield fly, the batter is out and there will be no force outs. Any base runners may advance at their own risk.

Sliding 

  • Feet-first sliding will be allowed, but head-first sliding is prohibited. Any base runner sliding head-first will be called out and be issued a yellow card.

Pitching 

  • A pitcher may have five warm up pitches at the start of the game and only one warm-up pitch between innings.
  • The pitcher must begin with both feet on the ground and with at least one foot touching the pitching rubber.
  • After making any motion to pitch the pitcher must immediately deliver the ball to the plate. The pitch must be made in one continuous motion.
  • The pitch must have a minimum arc of 6 feet from the ground and not to exceed 12 feet. In the event of an illegal pitch, the umpire will exclaim "illegal" and the pitch will be called a ball. However, if the batter swings at the ball, the pitch will be live.

Defensive Positioning 

  • Teams shall have no more than two males in the outfield, two males in the infield, and one male in the pitcher/catcher positions.
  • After the release of the pitch and prior to the ball being batted, defensive pitchers must be positioned within 10 feet of the pitcher's mound, behind the line created between first and third base.
  • Infield players must be positioned within the infield dirt and outfield players must be positioned behind the infield dirt before each pitched ball, and will not be allowed to cross their respective lines until the ball has been batted.
  • Teams must alternate gender in the outfield and infield.

NOTE: Violations to the Defensive Positioning rule will result in an automatic single or the result of the play, whichever the offensive team chooses.

Mercy Rule 

  • If a team is winning by 15 runs with 25 minutes or less left in the game, the game will be called.

**For additional information on eligibility and forfeit times, please see policies and procedures.
